name: Hambleden and Pheasant’s Hill trail, Central Chilterns

ai.summary: A demanding 18.1 km loop in the Central Chilterns, starting near Hambleden and incorporating Pheasant's Hill. The route blends rolling chalk-downland ridges with woodland trails and open fields, featuring several steep ascents and exposed viewpoints. It's suited to experienced hikers with solid navigation; plan for a full day and expect 6–8 hours depending on pace and conditions.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain including chalk downland tracks, woodlands, field edges, and occasional rough or muddy sections. Look for steep climbs, uneven surfaces, and stiles and gates. In good weather, expect wide views across the Chilterns; after rain paths may be muddy and slippery.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and daylight hours before setting out. Wear sturdy footwear and carry a waterproof layer. The route includes steep ascents and exposed sections; navigation aids are recommended as markers can be sparse in places. Tell someone your plan and expected return time. Carry ample water and snacking options, plus a charged phone and a means of charging. Be mindful of livestock, gates, and countryside access rules; leave gates as you find them. In winter, shorter daylight and mud can slow progress; consider starting early.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
Lightweight rain gear and extra layers
Mobile phone with offline maps and portable charger
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) when conditions are generally favorable; winter hikes are possible but often muddy and more challenging.

seo.title: Hambleden and Pheasant's Hill Trail – Central Chilterns, UK – 18.1 km Hard
seo.meta_description: Tackle the 18.1 km Hambleden and Pheasant's Hill Trail in the Central Chilterns. A challenging route with chalk downland, woodlands, and panoramic views. Plan for a full-day hike.
seo.h1: Hambleden and Pheasant's Hill Trail – Central Chilterns (UK)
